name: Giselle Martinez Negrette
title: Assistant Professor, Curriculum & Instruction
text: Martinez Negrette is working in dual language classrooms to explore how teachers mediate culture and how this mediation impacts teaching practices and social interactions between teachers and students.

name: Gabriel Rodrigeuz
title: Assistant Professor, Education Policy, Organization & Leadership
text: Rodriguez is partnering with Latinx educators from Highland Park High School to build upon existing efforts to improve Latinx students’ sense of belonging.

name: Stephanie Toliver
title: Assistant Professor, Curriculum & Instruction
text: Toliver co-designed a project to engage Urbana youth in exploring their identities and envisioning equitable Black futures through creative writing, speculative design and open discussions.

name: Mari Altshuler
title: Teaching Assistant Professor, Curriculum & Instruction
text: Altshuler is aiming to support a local school community and bring math teaching and learning to life for the College’s elementary education students.

name: Chris Napolitano
title: Associate Professor, Educational Psychology
text: Napolitano proposed a new course, Research in Action that integrates adolescent development, research design, and psychological measurement through a service learning partnership with a local youth-serving organization.

name: Emily Tarconish
title: Teaching Assistant Professor, Special Education
text: Tarconish is partnering with Community Choices, a local non-profit that works to support individuals with disabilities to maintain independence, to develop a business accessibility evaluation based on the feedback of disabled community members.
